text: grilled corn is one of summer's biggest
crowd pleasers with sugar sweet kernels
that are covered in sweet butter it's
that time of year summer corn season and
I'm sure you've encountered this before
where you're grilling your corn and it
gets super charred on the outside and
it's not really tender and sweet well
today I'm going to show you a really fun
way to grill your corn I want to first
show you when my favorite tricks in
removing the silk from the corn to start
you're gonna husk the corn and what does
that mean well basically means you're
going to take the husk or the leaves
around the ear of corn and you're going
to pull them back now these pesky little
hairs are a pain in the you-know-what
and you really have to get rid of these
so you can use your hands to grasp the
silk and discard it but if there are any
strands that are sticking to the ear
itself like this one cool trick take a
stiff bristled brush this is just a
vegetable brush here and just brush the
silk away and it gets all of that pesky
silk off of the corn isn't that kind of
cool so there you go you have a
perfectly clean ear of corn free of all
of that pesky silk now this is a cool
trick in grilling corn what you're going
to do is going to take all the husk here
and you're going to put it back over the
corn cob and now this goes right into a
bowl of cold water or a pot and what
you're going to do is just submerge the
corn and let it bathe in this water what
it does is the water gets trapped
underneath the leaves of the husk and
when it goes on to the grill it's going
to create steam so get perfectly tender
corn and you'll also get that wonderful
grilled flavor so ten minutes I'm going
to keep finishing up my corn here and
then we're ready to grill so it's been
about ten minutes
the corn has been soaking bathing in its
little bath here and just remove the
corn to a towel to kind of drain off any
of that excess water you only really
need a little bit to cling on to the ear
of corn and the inside of the husk make
sure that your grill is preheated you
want to go to about a medium
I eat on your grill I'm using a grill
pan today because we're indoors so this
is medium-high heat you want to make
sure that it's nice and hot again you
can test that with a little bit of water
it should evaporate immediately and kind
of bounce off gonna oil the grates of
the grill so there's nothing sticking to
it so just a paper towel with a little
bit of safflower oil or grapeseed oil a
high smoke point oil just a little bit
here and now what you're gonna do is
just take your corn and place it
directly on the grill and now this will
take about 15 to 20 minutes you want to
keep rotating the corn as the husk it's
nice and blistered and charred its but
in 15 to 20 minutes you should have nice
tender corn okay so it's been about 20
minutes and the corn is nicely charred
on the outside it smells great in here
now you want to remove these to a
cutting board and now of course you want
to get the corn right to the table so
use a towel here guys maybe even two to
help you out and you're going to peel
back the husk and the corn should be
perfectly cooked nice and tender really
hot you can top this with so many
different things you can use some melted
butter that's my favorite with a little
bit of salt and pepper or you could use
your favorite spice blend a chili blend
would be really great
some nice cotija cheese or Parmesan
cheese goes really great with corn
especially grilled like this so there
you go maybe I'll give this one a little
bit of butter a sprinkling of salt a
little over the shoulder for good luck
and a little bit of pepper
and there you have it guys an easy and
fun way to grill corn this summer now if
you have any grilling conundrums or
kitchen conundrums or whatever let us
know write in the comment section below

enjoy the summer guys
